column1: ap 05:00|"five o’clock"|"“If we camp at the base of those hills
column2: we’ll be out of that wind

column1: Jim. “It’s five o’clock. We ought to make it in an hour.”"|"Dwellers in the Mirage"|"A. Merritt"
ap 10:00|"Ten o’clock"|"We went into the tent. We had been in it before with Evalie. It had been
empty then except for a pile of soft pelts and silken stuffs at one side. Now
there were two such piles. We shed our clothes in the pale green darkness and
turned in. I looked at my watch.
“Ten o’clock
column2: ” I said. “How many months since morning?”

column1: “At least six. If you keep me awake I’ll murder you. I’m tired.”"|"Dwellers in the Mirage"|"A. Merritt"
~ 12:00|"about noon"|"Jim left with a party of about a hundred of the pygmies about noon. I bade
him a cheerful good-bye. If it puzzled Evalie that I took his departure so
calmly
column2: and asked her no questions she did not show it. But she was very

column1: quiet that day
column2: speaking mostly in monosyllables abstractedly. Once or twice

column1: I caught her looking at me with a curious wonder in her eyes. And once I had
taken her hand
column2: and she had quivered and leaned toward me

column1: it away
column2: half-angrily. And once when she had forgotten her moodiness and had

column1: rested against my shoulder
column2: I had fought hard against taking her in my

column1: arms."|"Dwellers in the Mirage"|"A. Merritt"
00:00|midnight|"It was night. It was essential to reach the edge of the forest before the
last third of the stretch between midnight and dawn. The hoofs of the horses
were muffled so that no sharp ears might hear their distant tread
soldiers marched in open formation
column2: noiselessly. Five days had passed since I

column1: had first looked on the fortress."|"Dwellers in the Mirage"|"A. Merritt"
ap 05:00|five|"Five left… only five now… Luka
column2: a temple to you in Karak—all

column1: your own
column2: sweet goddess!"|"Dwellers in the Mirage"|"A. Merritt"
